meanings.definition: To spread out in a disorderly or sprawling manner.
meanings.sent1: The cat spraddles across the bed, taking up all the space.
meanings.sent2: She spraddles her arms wide to show how big the fish was.
meanings.sent3: The toddler spraddles on the floor, playing with toys scattered around.
meanings.sent4: The vines spraddled across the fence, creating a natural barrier.
meanings.sent5: The paint spraddles on the canvas, forming a chaotic yet intriguing pattern.

meanings.definition: The act of spreading out in a disorderly or sprawling manner.
meanings.sent1: The spraddles of toys on the floor made it hard to walk.
meanings.sent2: His spraddles in the sand left a trail of footprints behind.
meanings.sent3: The spraddles of papers on her desk made it look messy but cozy.
meanings.sent4: The spraddles of branches in the forest created a natural canopy.
meanings.sent5: The spraddles of clouds in the sky painted a beautiful sunset scene.
